page.title: 03Local History Of Beckermet
page.content: There are 3 listed buildings in our area.Pelham House which was built in 1780,with a later extension.This used to be a residential school for delinquent boys.The Old Church Of St.Bridget which is a small rectangular building quite difficult to find,made from sandstone.It was built in 1878,is the third church to be built in the same site.It has an Anglo-Saxon cross in its graveyard.Sella Park House was built in 1770,incorporating a 14th century Pele tower.It is built with red sandstone.It is now a hotel. Beckermet is so called because 2 streams Blackbeck and Kirkbeck meet in the centre of the village.Godderthwaite got its name from Godhath veit which is an Anglo-Saxon name meaning the lawmans cleared land.Sellafields name comes from an Anglo-Saxon name meaning a dairy field.
